text: Edison Elementary School is the name of a K–8 grade school in the town of Edison, Washington. Its mascot is the Wildcat. == History == The original building was built in 1914 and was used for Edison High School, but by the late 1940s, Edison had partnered with nearby Burlington to create the Burlington-Edison School District, including a new high school, Burlington- Edison High School. In 1996, the district tore down the original building and constructed a new building for Edison Elementary. == References == Category:Public elementary schools in Washington (state) Category:Education in Skagit County, Washington Category:Buildings and structures in Skagit County, Washington Category:Public middle schools in Washington (state)
title: Edison Elementary School (Edison, Washington)
